intro: Cyanea aspera, commonly known as the rough cyanea, is a species of flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. Cyanea aspera thrives in coastal and upland habitats, often found in dry, rocky areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
